column1: Number of Establishments Employing 20 or More Workers With Preventive and Control Measures/Activities Against Work Safety and Health Hazards by Region, Philippines: 2021
https://openstat.psa.gov.ph/PXWeb/pxweb/en/DB/DB__1B__ISLE__OSHP/5001B3GO050.px/table/tableViewLayout1/?rxid=3049f06d-0444-47da-a5f4-70953d8d74ce
Preventive and Control Measures/Activities
Total
Organized safety and health committee
Designated safety/health officers and/or first-aiders

Regularly conducted identification, assessment and control of occupational safety and health hazards and risks such as fall from height, slips, trips or exposure to chemicals, noise, ergonomic hazards, etc. in the workplace
Conducted Work Environment Measurement (WEM)
Assessed efficiency of ventilation system
Conducted periodic/annual medical examination of workers
Installed machine guards on moving parts/equipment
Regularly inspected and conducted maintenance of equipment, mechanical and electrical facilities
Developed safety manuals, labels or maintenance procedures
Practiced proper labeling, handling, storage and disposal of chemicals/hazardous materials
Utilized safety data sheet for chemicals
Provided appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE) such as respirators, hard hat, safety shoes, safety goggles, gloves, etc. and regularly monitored its proper use and maintenance
Performed corrective action programs and audits
Conducted emergency response preparedness activities for earthquake, fire, chemical spills, etc.
Disseminated information materials on safety and health
Posted safety signages or warnings
Analyzed/Evaluated safety and health performance
Submitted OSH Program to DOLE as required by Department Order No. 198-18
Submitted reports on illnesses/injuries to DOLE as required by the Occupational Safety and Health Standards (OSHS)
Others
